docs.snippet: SHAWE--Irvin Burl "Big Irv," 83, passed away peacefully on April 7, 2014 in New York City after bravely fighting leukemia for the past year. He was born in Norfolk, VA on August 8, 1930, to the late Philip and Pearl Shawe. Irv was a longtime resid...
docs.lead_paragraph: SHAWE--Irvin Burl "Big Irv," 83, passed away peacefully on April 7, 2014 in New York City after bravely fighting leukemia for the past year. He was born in Norfolk, VA on August 8, 1930, to the late Philip and Pearl Shawe. Irv was a longtime resident of Virginia and Washington, DC, he also lived in Los Angeles, CA, Palm Beach, FL, Las Vegas, NV, and finally New York City. Irv was a true entrepreneur and built many businesses including art galleries, the first of which was in the New York World's Fair. He was also a renowned real estate broker. Irv loved sports, especially football, and he shared his passion with his sons. Most recently, the family attended Super Bowl XLVIII together. Irv is survived by and will be dearly missed by his sons, Eric Shawe and his wife Dolores of West Palm Beach, FL, Larry Shawe, his wife Renee and their daughter Ava Capri of New York City and Palm Beach Gardens, FL, and Phil Shawe and his wife Joanna of New York City, his siblings, Earle K. Shawe of Baltimore, MD, Norman Schikevitz of Boynton Beach, FL, Rosalie Kolker of Bethesda, MD, Katie Klein of Chevy Chase, MD and Bette Belle Becker of Chevy Chase, MD, and his love Shirley Shawe. Irv will also be missed by his extended family and friends. Funeral services for Irv will be held on Sunday, April 13, 2014 at 12pm at the Star of David Cemetery, located at 9321 Memorial Park Road, West Palm Beach, FL. In lieu of flowers, the Shawe family kindly asks that modest donations are made to the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society in Irv's honor via the following website: http://www.crowdrise.com/ InMemoryofBigIrv/ fundraiser/shawefamily

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SHAWE, IRVIN BURL "BIG IRV," 83
